Use it to **organize any information that people need to find and reference
easily** , like your organisation's travel policies, design guidelines, or
marketing assets.

 **To start, you might want to:**

  *  **Create a new page** by clicking the **+** in the space sidebar.

###### NEED INSPIRATION?

Check out our guide on building better documentation to learn best practices
for creating and organizing documents in Confluence.

Here are some tips to get you started. You can edit this page to see how it
works!

## 1\. Create a page

  * Click "Create" and select "Blank Page" to create your first page.
  * New pages are created as children of the page you are currently viewing.

## 2\. Add to your page

  * Click "Edit" to enter the Confluence editor and use the page layouts feature to structure your content using sections and columns.
  * Use headings to format your text and drag and drop images into your page to provide visual interest.
  * Click "Insert" and select "Other Macros" to add macros for navigation, special formatting and other media.

 **On this page:**

## 3\. Organise your pages

Here are some tips for organising your content.

  * #### Change the page order

The sidebar on the left displays your pages in a hierarchy. If you have Space
Administrator permissions you can click "Space Tools" > "Reorder Pages" to
move pages around.

  * #### Add labels

Labels help keep pages organised and make it easier for you to find the
information you need. Click "Labels" at the bottom of a page to add or edit.
The "Related pages" section on this page uses labels too!

  * #### Make templates

Standardise and speed up the page creation process with templates. You can
create and format a template with page layouts, standard headings and
instructional text for hints and guidelines. Check out our sample page on ""

Give your authors a helping hand by using templates in your documentation
space. You will need Space Administrator permissions to create templates.

To create a template:

  1. Go to "Space Tools" in the sidebar, select "Content Tools" and create a new template.
  2. Click "Page Layout" and add sections and columns to your page.
  3. Add headings and sub-headings as needed.
  4. Choose "Instructional Text" from the "Template" menu and add text that is only visible in the editor.
  5. Save your template.

Your template will become available in the Create dialog for this space.

Now as a trend, Organizations, always looking to establish their trade name in
the economical world and uplift their reputation continuously. As a result,
Companies’ Administrations always looking for upgrading their Company
qualities and get some world-recognized certifications. In Information
Technology (IT) companies (majorly cloud base) majorly looking for their
security qualities and they try to achieve world-recognized security
certifications like ISO 27001, GDPR ( **G** eneral **D** ata **P** rotection
**R** egulation), SOC 2 and CMMI, etc.

“ **Cybermity** ” is an automated web application which is developed and
powered by Kodez Consulting, and It is Priority goal is to consult their
customers to make qualifications and to be qualified in selected
Organizational security certification. It provides any kind of security
certification consultation.

 **The Chief Technical development officer (CTO)** can create an account in
Cybermity by using his company details (like company registration number,
category of the company according to the company vision and mission, etc.).
CTO can create an account using only one verified domain email. If S/he
successfully creates an account, the system will start sending product
notifications and the promotional data to the CTO with S/he Permission. After
creating an account, he/she should log in to the Cybermity account using a
valid domain and password. If CTO tries to log in using invalid credentials 3
times, the System temporarily disables the account, and CTO must use an Auto-
generated key or backup key or contact the consumer company help center to
validate the company information. CTO can renew the password If S/he forgets
the password, but the system does not allow to use of previous passwords.
[1]Then CTO can create only one tenant for his company (owner of the tenant).
Once create a tenant, System notified to CTO through email. But if CTO works
in multiple companies, he can manage multiple tenants separately. CTO can
create a project inside the selected tenant and can assign managers (using
employee pool) to it. Only for CTO has permission to delete a tenant or
project from the Cybermity account without giving a valid reason. Not only
those responsibilities but also he/she can generate completion reports but CTO
only can view the progress and feedback/complaints. CTO can create and manage
employee pool in the tenant (That can be helpful for assigning all client
employees to the relevant positions/responsibilities in the Cybermity
project). when employees add to the pool, CTO should create a valid
organizational email address as the username and a temporary password.

When **a client manager** is assigned to the project, the system sends an
invitation mail to join them. The client Manager can be an **Active manager**
or **Review manager**. If a manager has knowledge about the relevant
technology, CTO can tag as an active manager or else tag as a review manager.
Managers can only work or monitor in limited projects which are assigned by
the CTO. The review manager can only view the project details and in this
situation, CTO can assign supervisors (already have permissions but especially
for this situation), or else CTO can assign an active manager to the same
project. Both Active manager and Review manager can deal with the consumer
experts and, Both Active manager and Review manager can manage the project
timelines. If a project exceeded its deadline, Both the Active manager and
Review manager could extend it without any permission. Also, the Active
Manager can assign supervisors to steps areas in the permitted projects, but
he/she has only permission to modify the project client-side activity details.
All client managers can see the progress percentage of each step area Stress
level indicators (color indicator) and can view the progress and
feedback/complaints. Active managers have the ability to set timers to each
step/step area (not essential), but if there is only a review manager to a
project, this ability belongs to CTO.

When a **supervisor** is assigned to the project steps, the system sends an
invitation mail to join them. Supervisors should work on the project's steps
areas and each step in a steps area has a deadline which CTO/client manager
assigned. Every supervisor should finish them before the project's deadline if
a deadline is assigned. If project reach to the deadline and still it is not
complete, the system sends a warning mail to managers and CTO.

All client managers can see the progress percentage of each step area Stress
level indicators (color indicator) and can view the progress and
feedback/complaints. Active managers have the ability to set timers to each
step/step area (not essential), but if there is only a review manager to a
project, this ability belongs to CTO.

When a **supervisor** is assigned to the project steps, the system sends an
invitation mail to join them. Supervisors should work on the project's steps
areas and each step in a steps area has a deadline which CTO/client manager
assigned. Every supervisor should finish them before the project's deadline if
a deadline is assigned. If project reach to the deadline and still it is not
complete, the system sends a warning mail to managers and CTO. If project step
deadline is exceeded, and if CTO or manager wants to extend or reactive the
step/s. steps count, steps area counts, the effort for each steps area, the
behavior of the step, and the approximate deadline of the step area (it helps
the client company to get decisions about deadline assigned to the whole
project or step areas or steps) depend on the certification selection. The
client company can work on one or more steps parallelly but if one step
depends on another step, supervisors should complete the parent step before
starting the child step. If any step is completed system notified the CTO and
managers through the mail. Also, when a step area or complete all step areas
completed (project completed), as normal system notified it to the CTO and
managers through a mail and sent a mail to the assigned consumer expert/s to
review the completed project step area / the whole project. If Company uses
Cybermity free or if the client use Cybermity Ultimate subscription, the
client has the ability to request from Cybermity to review steps (as the
client wants).

On Consumer-side, **Chief Security Officer (CSO)** can also create projects in
client tenants, if only according to the client's complaint. When the project
created, system send a mail to CTO for notify it. CSO has permission to all
consumer side activities and monitoring them. CSO’s major responsibility is
assign managers to one or more tenants. When a manager assigned to the tenant,
system send an invitation mail for join them. Otherwise CSO can check count of
the tenant in system, ongoing project count and generate reports. Not only
those things, but he /she also can view the overall analytics stats. CSO can
perform any manager activities. CSO also can create employee pool (That can be
helpful for assign all client employees to the relevant the positions /
responsibilities in Cybermity project). when employees add to the pool, CSO
should create the valid organizational email address as username and a
temporary password.

 **Consumer Manager** also can create projects in client tenants When the
project created, system send a mail to CTO for notify it. Manager should
assign experts using employee pool to projects and manager can monitor one or
more tenants at once. Also, one tenant can be monitor by one or more experts.
Once an assign an expert to the project, system will be notified relevant
expert, and the client managers and the CTO.

 **Experts** are specialized to the relevant certifications, and they can work
in any permissioned tenants and projects. Also, can monitor assigned projects.
When the client managers finished their steps area or complete whole project,
assigned expert should review their all projects works (system notified it).
If there are some steps to review by visiting site/ location, expert can
assign a site review team and schedule a date, time for that. When expert
assign a review team, system sends email as notification to each member or the
assigned review team. Expert can approved / reject the client steps feedback
and if step rejected, expert should put remark feedback including rejection
facts. Then System will notify them to client managers through emails. CTO/
Client managers should make a payment for when re-review the failed step area
or step to Cybermity app or additional review (Ultimate subscribers can get 2
re-reviews and 2 additional reviews free). A step cannot be complete without
expert’s approval and steps which wants site reviews cannot be complete
without both experts and site reviewers’ approval.

 **Site/Location reviewers** are review clients’ physical requirements and
analyze them which changes are fit to get certification or not under the
experts’ instructions.

When expert
assign a review team, system sends email as notification to each member or the
assigned review team. Expert can approved / reject the client steps feedback
and if step rejected, expert should put remark feedback including rejection
facts. Then System will notify them to client managers through emails. CTO/
Client managers should make a payment for when re-review the failed step area
or step to Cybermity app or additional review (Ultimate subscribers can get 2
re-reviews and 2 additional reviews free). A step cannot be complete without
expert’s approval and steps which wants site reviews cannot be complete
without both experts and site reviewers’ approval.

 **Site/Location reviewers** are review clients’ physical requirements and
analyze them which changes are fit to get certification or not under the
experts’ instructions. If there is an unusual procedure or a system which
directly or not directly effect to the certification or not satisfied, site
reviewer can reject the step with give remark with facts. That remark
notification email sends to expert by the system. If site reviewers satisfied,
they inform their approval to the expert by using Cybermity system. If client
wants to review their site as an additional service or if client wants to get
re-approval their failed site visit reviewing steps, they should pay
additional payment to the Cybermity. (Ultimate subscribers can get 2 re-
reviews and 2 additional reviews free).

** _SWOT Analysis. – According to the parallel product research._**

 **Strengths**

  * Have idea.

  * Have proper knowledge about world-recognized security certifications.

  * Have plenty of experts who specialize in each security certification and development. 

  * Have initial investment to start the project.

 **Weaknesses**

  * · There are no more free parallel products to run and get an idea about the functionality of these products.

  * · Should find proper technologies and secure methods to implement it.

 **Opportunities**

o All other security consulting applications are conducted based on emails and
some companies give their consultations on their premises (No digital
platforms).

o There are limited numbers of software (not web applications), and its
purchase prices are high.

o  If we can sell our product at an affordable price, we can get huge
attraction in security consulting business field.

o Some companies do not respond to their clients quickly (most consultation
companies which based on emails and XSL).

 **Threats**

· In this pandemic situation, most consulting companies looking for automating
their security consulting services.

· According to the Gartner analysis report, famous security consultation
companies should have already alternative plans or products to give a
challenge to upcoming products.

· Nowadays people move to cloud base systems. Because of that, there is a
possibility to change current certification qualifications (Sometimes can
change certification also).

**Cybermity Subscription Plans.**

 **· Monthly Subscription.**

 **OR**

 **· Certification Based Subscription.**

 **OR**

 **· Feature-wise Subscription.**

**01\. Monthly Subscription.**

When clients purchase the Cybermity monthly subscription, they can get all
beneficial features freely which provides Cybermity. – (Subscription counts
depend on the client’s completion speed).

 **02\. Certification-Based Subscription.**

When the client purchases the Certification Based subscription, the client’s
subscription fee depends on the count of step areas. We all know A
certification project is made from collection of qualification steps areas.
So, we can make a one package deadline according to the summation of steps
completion deadlines days and assign one value for that bundle. (Client sticks
to a plan for performance). – (fair benefits to both clients and to Kodez also
this depends on the client’s completion speed).

 **03\. Feature in Subscription.**

We provide some features to clients according to their purchased package type.
There are some package types.

 **· Basic Package – (free version).**

 **· Ultimate Package – (All facilities).**

 **Basic Package Facilities –**

  1. 24 x 7 Customer Support.

 **Ultimate Package Facilities -**

  1. 24 x 7 Customer Support.

  2. Steps reviewing enable.

  3. Free 2 re-reviews (configurable for specific clients). – (default ultimate package benefits are coming from pre-assign variables)

  4. Free 2 Site visit additional reviews (configurable for specific clients). - (default ultimate package benefits are coming from pre-assign variables)

  5. Generate report facility Activated.

  6. Kodez Cybermity success paths guidance activated. – (guidance video series.).

  7. Cross-domain employee assigning ability activated.

**Business Strategies.**

  1.  **Application point system – (goal-uplift the clients and consumer party motivation)**

(Below point criteria affected to all clients and the consumer experts/team).

· Give a point for the completion of the selected steps (0.5 pts).

· Give a point for the completion of the selected steps areas without any
rejections due to the deadline (1.5 pts).

· Give a point for the completion of the whole project due to the deadline (25
pts).

· Clients can use these collected points to purchase their next certification
in Cybermity as a discount.

· CSO uses those points to make employee salary increments and other
allowance. (encouraging consumer-side employees)

**2\. Gives free demonstration to identify the application behavior.**

If some clients want to know the workflow of Cybermity before purchasing or
use, this demonstration will be helpful for them. This demo will help to walk
through the whole application. In my thoughts, Time should be (5-10mins
(maximum limit -10mins)).

2\. Charge for additional services (when a client using a free package).

a. If clients request an additional review.

b. Reactive timeout projects/steps areas/ steps.

c. Re-review sites or steps areas /steps.

**3\. Play Kodez products and services advertisements for free accounts.
-(using side panel bars)**

Mainly target our clients to encourage them to solve their business aspects
and other business consultations by using current Kodez products and services.
Also, it will be helpful for opening a new way to Kodez marketing.

Now as trend, Organizations, always looking establish their trade name in the
economical world and uplifting their reputation continuously. As a result,
Companies’ Administrations always looking for upgrade their Company qualities
and get some world recognized certifications. In Information Technology (IT)
companies (majorly cloud base) majorly looking for their security qualities
and they try to achieve world recognized security certifications like ISO
27001, GDPR ( **G** eneral **D** ata **P** rotection **R** egulation), SOC 2
and CMMI etc.

“ **Cybermity** ” is an automated web application which is developed and
powered by Kodez Consulting, and It is Priority goal is consult their
customers to make qualification and to be qualified in selected Organizational
security certification. It provides any kind of security certification
consultations.

 **Chief Technical development officer (CTO)** can create an account in
Cybermity by using his company details (like company registration number,
category of the company according to the company vision and mission etc.). CTO
can create account using only one verified domain email. If S/he successfully
create account, system will start sent product notifications and the
promotional data to the CTO with S/he Permission. After creating account,
he/she should login to the Cybermity account with using valid domain and
password. If CTO tries to login using invalid credentials in 3 times, System
temporary disabled the account and CTO must use Auto-generated key or backup
key or contacting consumer company help center for validate the company
information. CTO can renew the password If S/he forget the password, but
system do not allow to use previous passwords. [1]Then CTO can create only one
tenant for his company (owner of the tenant). Once create a tenant, System
notified it to CTO through email. But if CTO works in multiple companies, he
can manage multiple tenants separately. CTO can create project inside the
selected tenant and can assign managers (using employee pool) to it. Only for
CTO has permission to delete a tenant or project from the Cybermity account
with giving valid reason. Not only those responsibilities, also he/she can
generate completion reports but CTO only can view the progress and
feedback/complains. CTO can create and manage employee pool in the tenant
(That can be helpful for assign all client employees to the relevant the
positions / responsibilities in Cybermity project). when employees add to the
pool, CTO should create the valid organizational email address as username.
Then system send an email with link to join them. If employee does not
register to the system yet, he should create an account and join to assigned
position through the mailed link.

 *****Special Note: Once employee (both client-side and consumer-side) added
to the employee pool or assign employee to the specific role, system send a
mail with link to assigned / added employees. If employee already registered
to the system, he/she can join to assigned role in the system easily by
clicking the mailed link. Else other employees (not register yet) should
register to the system and join to the system role through the given mail.**

When **a client manager** assigned to the project, system send an invitation
mail for join them. Client Manager can be **Active manager** or **Review
manager**. If manager has knowledge about the relevant technology, CTO can tag
as active manager or else tag as review manager. Managers can only work or
monitor in limited projects which is assigned by the CTO. Review manager can
only view the project details and in this situation, CTO can assign
supervisors (already have permissions but specially for this situation) or
else CTO can assign an active manager to the same project. Both Active manager
and Review manager can deal with the consumer experts and, Both Active manager
and Review manager can manage the project timelines. If a project exceeded its
deadline, Both Active manager and Review manager could extend it without any
permission. Also, Active Manager can assign supervisors to steps areas in
permitted project, but he/she has only permission to modify the project
client-side activity details. All client managers can see the progress
percentage of each step areas Stress level indicators (color indicator) and
can view the progress and feedback/complains. Active managers have ability to
set timers to each steps/step areas (not essential), but if there only review
manager to a project, this ability belongs to CTO.

Both Active manager
and Review manager can deal with the consumer experts and, Both Active manager
and Review manager can manage the project timelines. If a project exceeded its
deadline, Both Active manager and Review manager could extend it without any
permission. Also, Active Manager can assign supervisors to steps areas in
permitted project, but he/she has only permission to modify the project
client-side activity details. All client managers can see the progress
percentage of each step areas Stress level indicators (color indicator) and
can view the progress and feedback/complains. Active managers have ability to
set timers to each steps/step areas (not essential), but if there only review
manager to a project, this ability belongs to CTO.

When a **supervisor** assigned to the project steps, system send an invitation
mail for join them. Supervisors should work on the projects steps areas and
each step in a steps area has a deadline which CTO/client manager assigned.
Every supervisor should finish them before projects deadline if a deadline
assigned. If project reach to the deadline and still it is not complete,
system send a warning mail to managers and CTO. If project step deadline
exceeded, and if CTO or manager wants to extend or reactive the step/s. steps
count, steps area counts, effort for each steps area, behavior of the step and
the approximate deadline of the step area (it helps to client company for get
decisions about deadline assign to whole project or step areas or steps)
depends on the certification selection. Client company can work on one or more
steps parallelly but if one step depends on another step, supervisors should
complete parent step before starting child step. If any step completed system
notified it to the CTO and managers through a mail. Also, when a step area or
complete all step areas completed (project completed), as normally system
notified it to the CTO and managers through a mail and sent a mail to the
assigned consumer expert/s to review the completed project step area / whole
project. If Company use Cybermity free of if client use Cybermity Ultimate
subscription, client have ability to request from Cybermity to review steps
(as client wants).

In Consumer-side, **Chief Security Officer (CSO)** can also create projects in
client tenants, if only according to the clients complain. When the project
created, system send a mail to CTO for notify it. CSO has permission to all
consumer side activities and monitoring them. CSO’s major responsibility is
assign managers to one or more tenants. When a manager assigned to the tenant,
system send an invitation mail with link for join them. Otherwise CSO can
check count of the tenant in system, ongoing project count and generate
reports. Not only those things, but he /she also can view the overall
analytics stats. CSO can perform any manager activities. CSO also can create
employee pool (That can be helpful for assign all client employees to the
relevant the positions / responsibilities in Cybermity project). when
employees add to the pool, CSO should create the valid organizational email
address as username and a temporary password. Not only that CSO has ability to
customize the features in paid subscriptions for special clients.

 **Consumer Manager** also can create projects in client tenants When the
project created, system send a mail to CTO for notify it. Manager should
assign experts using employee pool (once employee assign as expert system send
an invitation mail with link for join them) to projects and manager can
monitor one or more tenants at once. Also, one tenant can be monitor by one or
more experts. Once an assign an expert to the project, system will be notified
relevant expert, and the client managers and the CTO.

 **Experts** are specialized to the relevant certifications, and they can work
in any permissioned tenants and projects. Also, can monitor assigned
projectsbut they can see all the project step area details as read. When the
client managers finished their steps area or complete whole project, assigned
expert should review their all projects works (system notified it). If there
are some steps to review by visiting site/ location, expert can assign a site
review team and schedule a date, time for that. When expert assign a review
team, system sends email as notification with link to each member or the
assigned review team. Expert can approved / reject the client steps feedback
and if step rejected, expert should put remark feedback including rejection
facts. Then System will notify them to client managers through emails.

Once an assign an expert to the project, system will be notified
relevant expert, and the client managers and the CTO.

 **Experts** are specialized to the relevant certifications, and they can work
in any permissioned tenants and projects. Also, can monitor assigned
projectsbut they can see all the project step area details as read. When the
client managers finished their steps area or complete whole project, assigned
expert should review their all projects works (system notified it). If there
are some steps to review by visiting site/ location, expert can assign a site
review team and schedule a date, time for that. When expert assign a review
team, system sends email as notification with link to each member or the
assigned review team. Expert can approved / reject the client steps feedback
and if step rejected, expert should put remark feedback including rejection
facts. Then System will notify them to client managers through emails. CTO/
Client managers should make a payment for when re-review the failed step area
or step to Cybermity app or additional review (Ultimate subscribers can get 2
re-reviews and 2 additional reviews free). A step cannot be complete without
expert’s approval and steps which wants site reviews cannot be complete
without both experts and site reviewers’ approval.

 **Site/Location reviewers** are review clients’ physical requirements and
analyze them which changes are fit to get certification or not under the
experts’ instructions. If there is an unusual procedure or a system which
directly or not directly effect to the certification or not satisfied, site
reviewer can reject the step with give remark with facts. That remark
notification email sends to expert by the system. If site reviewers satisfied,
they inform their approval to the expert by using Cybermity system. If client
wants to review their site as an additional service or if client wants to get
re-approval their failed site visit reviewing steps, they should pay
additional payment to the Cybermity. (Ultimate subscribers can get 2 re-
reviews and 2 additional reviews free).

 **Data Entry Officer** is the responsible employee for enter the details
about Cybermity project. He should create templates of the certification like
step area/step templates to the system. In step areas there are so many steps
and step have single or multiple Questions. Also, Data entry officer should
input the estimated time for each step and step's questions and their hints.

Romano Security Consulting is a UK based organization which offers information
security consultancy services.

Romano Security Consulting offer the following SOC 2 consultancy services:

  * SOC 2 Audit Scoping Workshop

During the scoping workshop the following scoping elements are determined:

  1. the services provided to user entities (clients/customers)

  2. service commitments made to user entities (contracts and service level agreements)

  3. the system and principal system requirements used to provide the services

  4. the risks including from business suppliers and suppliers

  5. the applicable TSC categories (Security, Confidentiality, Availability, Processing Integrity, Privacy)

  6. the type of audit report required SOC 2 Type 1 or SOC 2 Type 2

  7. the period or timeframe to be covered

  8. the sub service organizations and extent of services provided

  * SOC 2 Readiness Assessment

The SOC 2 Readiness Assessment covers the following areas:

SOC audit scoping, which determines the boundaries and interfaces, specific
systems and services to be audited, risks, timeframes and type of SOC 2 audit

System description review, which examines the existing documentation available
e.g polices and procedures, org charts, network and system diagrams that would
makeup the system description

Applicability of the 5 TSC’s (Security, Confidentiality, Availability,
Processing Integrity, Privacy), which determines which of the 5 TSC’s
adequately mitigate identified risks

Control gap analysis assessment against the selected TSC controls to highlight
the control deficiencies, risks and weaknesses

The output of the SOC 2 Readiness Assessment is a detailed report of the
deficiencies identified during the assessment and a detailed roadmap on how to
achieve compliance with the AICPA TSC and how to prepare for your SOC 2 audit.

  * SOC 2 Remediation

Assistance in the following areas are provided in remediating the internal
control deficiencies identified.

Compiling or reviewing your system or service description, advising on the
makeup of the system description and what should be included

Risk assessment and risk management

Producing security policies and procedures

Advice on suitable TSC control design and implementation

Security awareness training

Defining control effectiveness measurements and metrics

Testing control effectiveness

Evidence selection and gathering

Conducting a SOC 2 pre audit or dry run assessment

Audit facilitation and working with the CPA auditors to ensure your audit runs
smoothly and you achieve your SOC 2 audit report

metadata.title: Scenario for Class and ER Diagrams
Scenario for Class and ER Diagrams

__data__.text:
In Cybermity, clients can register to the system in order to access the
services. They can be categorized as Chief Technical Officer (CTO), Client
Manager (Active Manager and Review Manager), Supervisor, Employee, Auditor
(Client-side, Freelancing), Client-side expert. The consumer side users are
Chief Security Officer, Expert Manager, Consumer-side expert, Site reviewer,
Data entry officer, Consumer-side auditor. All Users have common attributes
such as user Id (unique), name, email (unique), password. There will be a type
attribute to identify whether the user is a client or a consumer. Apart from
that, they will have an attribute to identify user role from those mentioned
previously.

Every client (CTO) can create one Tenant using one organizational email
domain. A tenant is uniquely identified by tenant id and contains the
attributes tenant name, company name and created date. Tenant has one or more
projects but Tenant can be created without any project. A project is created
using a certification template. A project has the attributes project id
(unique), name, created date and status. A project is assigned to one or more
client managers. Project should have one or many step questions. Client
manager assigns supervisors to project steps. Supervisor can make one or more
tasks for the employees in a project but a project can exist without tasks.
Tasks have a unique id, name and description. Supervisor answers to the
project steps. Step answers are identified by their id and have attributes
like answer, datetime and status. Every step answer should be assigned to
Consumer-side expert/s but sometimes step answers can also be assigned to
client-side expert/s. Both client-side step area assignments and consumer-side
step area assignments are identified by their ids.

Every Step Answer must be reviewed by the experts and a review result will be
given. A review has an id, date and approval status. According to the review
result, the system changes Status Log of the step area / step and generates a
time log for both client and consumer-side experts reviews. Review cannot be
without Time Log and Status Log. Time logs and status logs are both identified
by their log ids. Time logs have a comment, datetime, additional working
duration and status. Status logs have a reason, previous status and new
status. Some Reviews have Site Reviews but Review can exist without Site
Review. Site reviews have attributes like id (unique), approval status.

If Review Status Log is rejected, Client should fix errors and should make a
Re-Review Request with Review Payment. Re-Review Can exist without Review
Payment because if the client has an ultimate subscription, they already have
some free re-reviews. Clients can also request Additional Review Request by
doing a Review Payment. Additional Review Request can exist without Review
Payment but Review Payment should have at least one Additional Review Request
/ Re-Review Request. Re-Review Request and Additional Review Request both have
a unique id and a reason. Review Payment includes an id (unique), category,
amount, reason, datetime. A Re-Review or an Additional Review is identified by
their id and include approval state, remark.

Certification templates are added to the system by Data entry officer. They
are identified by their id and have attributes like name, created date,
status. Certification templates should contain at least one or more step areas
which are identified by their ids. They have attributes like step area number,
title, estimated time and number of steps. Each step area contains one or more
steps which have a unique id. The step index, name and description are also
saved. Each step/ step area may have one supporting video to explain it. There
can be steps without supporting videos but step areas must have a supporting
video. A supporting video will be identified by their id and contain
attributes like topic, description, path name and added date.

There are default security policy templates which will be added by Consumer-
side auditor or Data entry officer which can be used by clients. They are
identified by the policy template id and have the attributes name, type,
description, created by, status. A security policy template should contain one
or more topics belonging to it. A topic will have attributes like id(unique),
name and description. A topic may contain zero or more sub topics which will
be identified by their ids. Sub topics also have other attributes like name,
description.

CTO can assign a client-side auditor to the tenant.

metadata.title: Scenario for Class and ER Diagrams
Scenario for Class and ER Diagrams
Scenario for Class and ER Diagrams

__data__.text:
The step index, name and description are also
saved. Each step/ step area may have one supporting video to explain it. There
can be steps without supporting videos but step areas must have a supporting
video. A supporting video will be identified by their id and contain
attributes like topic, description, path name and added date.

There are default security policy templates which will be added by Consumer-
side auditor or Data entry officer which can be used by clients. They are
identified by the policy template id and have the attributes name, type,
description, created by, status. A security policy template should contain one
or more topics belonging to it. A topic will have attributes like id(unique),
name and description. A topic may contain zero or more sub topics which will
be identified by their ids. Sub topics also have other attributes like name,
description.

CTO can assign a client-side auditor to the tenant. A client-side auditor can
create security policy templates of their own or by customizing default
templates. When a client creates a template by customizing an inbuilt template
it is saved as a Custom Inbuilt Security Policy which is identified by custom
inbuilt policy id. The modified date and modified user will also be saved.
When client create their own security policy, they will follow a similar
procedure to the consumer-side auditor. However, any template created by
client-side auditor must be approved by the consumer-side auditor before they
are published (only for use in specific tenant). Client-side auditors can also
download/ import security policy templates to the projects in his/her own
tenant.

Freelancing auditors can create their own security policy templates and sell
them in the Cybermity marketplace after getting approval from the consumer-
side auditor. All approvals (or rejections) made by the consumer side auditor
will be saved and they will be identified by their id. Apart from that, it
will have attributes like approved date and status.

Both client-side and freelancing auditors can promote their templates sold to
the marketplace. For this, they can purchase a promotion (plan) and their
promotion purchases will be saved as client promotions. Client promotions are
identified their unique id and include the purchased date. Promotions will
contain attributes as id (unique), name, remarks, features, fee. There are 2
types of promotions. They are Advertising promotions and Discount promotions.
Advertising promotions will have attributes like promotion code, last valid
date, discount amount. Discount promotions contain discount amount, validity
period.

Cybermity marketplace will contain products like security policy templates and
Kodez products (services that can be added as addons). Users can sell zero or
more products in the marketplace. These products will be identified by an item
id and will have attributes like name, price, description, discount, published
date and category. Marketplace products will have zero or more addons which
are identiified by their ids and include name, price and facilities.

Kodez products can be advertised through the system. These products will have
a unique id, name, description and category. One product will have one
advertisement. An advertisement will be identified by its id and will have a
topic, body and advertising hour. There is an advertiser for each product
advertisement. Advertiser have one or more products to advertise. Advertiser
contains (unique) ID, name, company Name, email, mobile Number, address,
payment state and payment.

Cybermity provides a FAQ feature to clarify client's common doubts in
Cybermity working procedure. FAQ categorized under the FAQ Categories. Each
FAQ Category has one or more FAQs and FAQ Category cannot exist without FAQ.
Also, FAQ cannot exist without category. Normally, FAQ Category contains
(unique) ID, name and added date. FAQ contains (unique) ID, question, answer
and updated date.

Kodez products can be advertised through the system. These products will have
a unique id, name, description and category. One product will have one
advertisement. An advertisement will be identified by its id and will have a
topic, body and advertising hour. There is an advertiser for each product
advertisement. Advertiser have one or more products to advertise. Advertiser
contains (unique) ID, name, company Name, email, mobile Number, address,
payment state and payment.

Cybermity provides a FAQ feature to clarify client's common doubts in
Cybermity working procedure. FAQ categorized under the FAQ Categories. Each
FAQ Category has one or more FAQs and FAQ Category cannot exist without FAQ.
Also, FAQ cannot exist without category. Normally, FAQ Category contains
(unique) ID, name and added date. FAQ contains (unique) ID, question, answer
and updated date.

step including a supporting video and a hints document. The hints document can
be downloaded by clicking on the Download Hints Document button. By clicking
on the back button, system will redirect to the previous step question page.

sold in the marketplace. By clicking on the Back button, Client Manager can
view the list of security policies in the marketplace. S/he can also add the
item to cart or to wish list by clicking on the buttons Add to Cart and Add to
Wishlist respectively.

side experts for steps under a specific step area. From here, the Client
manager can view all details regarding a time log entered for a step with a
status of 'Pending’ or ‘Escalated’ by clicking on the View details button. By
clicking on the back button, the system will redirect to Certification project
step area details page.

This shows the list of security policy templates published by auditor for
usage within the tenant. Templates can be viewed or deleted. Also, a template
can be imported to the tenant from here. Client-side Auditor can sell the
published templates in the marketplace after getting the approval by the

template. Here, new topics can be entered and they will be displayed in the
list below the form. The added topics can be edited and deleted using buttons.
When Expand button is clicked, it redirects to the view showing the sub topics
that are under that specific topic. By clicking the Back button, system
redirects to Templates view.

This view shows the sold security policy templates of the Client-side auditor
that have not been promoted. The full view of the security policy template is
shown when view button is clicked. The Client-side auditor can also make a
promotion for the template using this view.

This view shows the promotion overview including a graphical representation of
the promotion details of the Client-side auditor and other statistical data.

button, system redirects to the view showing list of sub topics.

This view shows the summary of the completion report for the certification
project. The completion report can be generated and downloaded by clicking on
the Generate Completion Report button. By clicking on the Back button, CTO can
navigate to certification project details page.

This form is for the CTO to create a new tenant. The tenant color means the
color that the CTO would like to use to display the tenant in the ‘tenant
details’ view. By clicking on the Back button, CTO can navigate to Tenant
details page.

This view shows the step collections that have already been reviewed by the
Client-side expert. By clicking on Expand, the steps that come under the
selected step area can be displayed. By clicking on the Back button, Client-
side expert can navigate to Assigned project details page.

step including a supporting video and a hints document. The hints document can

on the Back button, system will redirect to the previous step question page.

view the list of security policy templates which are yet to be sold. S/he can
create new templates and delete existing templates. The common details of the
template can be viewed by the View button. Expand button is used to go to the
topic list that belongs to the template. The status of the project is shown as
a badge. When the status is Ongoing, the policy template can be previewed to
get a full view of the existing template content. Once the status becomes
Completed, the template can be sent for getting approval from the Consumer-
side Auditor. Once the status is approved, the template can be sold in the
marketplace by clicking on Sell Template button.

__data__.text:
This is the form used to make a promotion for a security policy template that
is sold in the marketplace. By clicking the Back button, system redirects to
the Non-promoted content view.

From this view, Client Manager can view details of certification projects. The
form to assign Client-side Experts can be accessed by clicking on the Assign
Client-side Experts button. By clicking on the Back button, Client Manager can
view the certification project details page.

This is the form to assign Client-side experts to review the step areas of a
certain project. From here, the Client manager can also edit and delete
Client-side experts that have already been assigned to that project. By
clicking on the Back button, the Client manager can navigate to the
certification project details view.

This is the dashboard interface of the Client-side Auditor. Here, s/he can
view the list of security policy templates which are yet to be published for
use. S/he can create new templates and delete existing templates. The common
details of the template can be viewed by the View button. Expand button is
used to go to the topic list that belongs to the template. The status of the
project is shown as a badge. When the status is Ongoing, the policy template
can be previewed to get a full view of the existing template content. Once the
status becomes Completed, the template can be released (published) for the use
within the organization’s tenants.

This shows the preview of sold templates. The details of the security policy
template can be viewed by View Details button. A new version of the template
can be created from Create New Version. By clicking the Back button, system
redirects to Sold Templates view.

This shows the preview of security policy templates that are currently
ongoing. From here, the auditor can download the policy template or edit
common details of the template. Once the template is finished, the auditor can
click on Mark as Complete to change the status of the template to Completed.
By clicking the Back button, system redirects to Templates view.

This view shows the sold security policy templates of the Client-side auditor
that have been promoted through a promotion plan. By clicking on view, auditor
can see all the details regarding the promotion. By clicking on extend
subscription, the auditor can extend the period of promotion by renewing the
promotion subscription.

This is the view showing the common details of a selected security policy
template. By clicking the Back button, system redirects to Templates view.

This is the view to update the details of a security policy template. Here,
only the template name, type and description can be edited. By clicking the
Back button, system redirects to Templates view.

metadata.title: Create Sub Topics for Security Policy Template
Create Sub Topics for Security Policy Template

template. By clicking the Back button, system redirects to the view showing
list of sub topics.

This is the form used to make a promotion for a security policy template that
is sold in the marketplace. By clicking the Back button, system redirects to
the Non-promoted content view.

metadata.title: Employee Project Allocation in Selected Project
Employee Project Allocation in Selected Project

__data__.text:
This view shows the employees added to a selected project. Allocate Employees
to Project button can be used to allocate more employees to that project from
the employee pool. By clicking on the Back button, CTO can navigate to
Employee Project Allocation details page.

metadata.title: Employee Project Allocation in Selected Project

__data__.text:
This view shows the tenants that the user has been assigned to and the tenants
s/he has created. The user can click on Add New Tenant to create a new tenant.
User can edit or delete the tenants that s/he has created.

This view shows the approval requests that have been sent to the Client-side
expert for the step areas of the selected project. By clicking on Expand, the
steps that come under the selected step area can be displayed. By clicking on
the Back button, Client-side expert can navigate to Assigned project details
page.

this view shows the questions and answers that have been submitted for
reviewal for the selected step. The expert can review the step answers and
either approve or decline. When declining adding a remark is required.
Clicking the Back button will redirect to step area view of approval requests.

This view shows the list of steps that come under a reviewed step area. By
clicking on the View button of a selected step, the step questions and answers
coming under that view can be displayed. Clicking the Back button will
redirect to the list of reviewed step areas. Generate Template Report button
used to generate template report for Client-side expert.

This view shows the step questions and answers belonging to a step area in a
certification project assigned to the supervisor. The supervisor can create
tasks to be completed by employees by clicking on Create Task button. S/he can
also fill in answers to step questions and submit. Apart from that, s/he can
request for a site review. The questions coming under a step can be displayed
one at a time as well. By clicking the Back button, system redirects to the
previous page or the board view. Supervisor can navigate to the FAQ and
supporting material pages by clicking on Help.

This shows the list view of task details that come under a specific step in a
specific project step area. By clicking on the View button, more details
regarding the tasks can be displayed.

metadata.title: New Trended Security Policies In Marketplace - Supervisor
New Trended Security Policies In Marketplace - Supervisor

__data__.text:
This view shows the Cybermity marketplace. Here, the trending security
policies, company policies and other products can be displayed separately
using tabs. Using the View button, additional details regarding the selected
item can be viewed. Supervisor can make a request to purchase that item and it
will be notified to the Client manager or the CTO.

metadata.title: New Trended Security Policies In Marketplace - Supervisor

__data__.text:
This is the form to create a task to be completed by a certain employee. By
clicking on the Back button, system will redirect to the view showing the step
questions.

This shows the list view of task details that come under a specific step in a
specific project step area. By clicking on the View button, more details
regarding the tasks can be displayed.

This is the view showing the common details of a selected security policy
template. By clicking the Back button, system redirects to Templates view.

This shows the preview of sold templates. The details of the security policy
template can be viewed by View Details button. A new version of the template
can be created from Create New Version. By clicking the Back button, system
redirects to Published Templates view.

This view shows the details of the existing subscriptions. These details can
be viewed or edited using the View and Edit buttons. A new subscription can be
added using the Add New Subscription button. An existing subscription can be
deleted from Delete button.

This view shows the new trending items in the marketplace. They will be
categorized under security policies, company policies and other products. The
newest trends of each category will be displayed at the top. Here also,
additional details can be viewed by clicking on the View button. CSO can also
add items to the Wishlist by clicking on Add to Wishlist. Items can be added
to cart using the Add to cart button.

metadata.title: Step Area List in Certificate Template
Step Area List in Certificate Template

__data__.text:
This view shows the list of step areas that come under the selected default
certification template. New step areas can be created using the Create New
Step Area. By clicking on the Expand button, the steps that come under the
step area can be viewed. The details of the step area can be edited using the
Edit details button. Existing step areas can be deleted by Delete button. FAQs
related to the step area can be added using the Add FAQs button. By clicking
on the Back button, the list of default certification templates can be viewed.

metadata.title: Step Area List in Certificate Template

__data__.text:
This is the view showing the approved security policy templates. The details
of the approved policy templates can be edited by using the Edit button. The
preview of the policy template content can be viewed by the Preview button. By
clicking on the Expand button, Data entry officer can navigate to the list of
topics coming under the template.

This form is used to add a new employee to the Cybermity employee pool. By
clicking on the Back button, the system will navigate to ‘Employee details’
view.

This is the read only view for the selected customizable subscription plan. In
order to add features for the customizable subscription plan, the button
Assign features should be clicked. By clicking the Back button, CSO can
navigate to the Customized Subscription details page.

This is the page showing the details of projects that come under a specific
tenant. A new project can be added by clicking on the Add New Project button.
The details of the existing projects can be viewed by View button. The details
can be changed by Edit button. By clicking on the Back button, the system
redirects to the tenant details view of selected tenant. The Expert manager
also has the ability to block a client project by clicking on the Block
button.

This page shows the preview of the selected certification template that have
been to be approved by the Expert manager. The Expert manager can review the
certification template and either approve or decline. When declining adding a
remark is required. By clicking on the Back button, the system redirects to
the page showing the certification templates to be approved.

This is the view for displaying the details of a selected step. FAQs can be
added to the step by using the Add FAQs button.
This is the form to create a new sub topic under a selected topic.

Some of the common kinds of wireframes for pages that can be accessed by
multiple users are included here.

 **Main Sections -**

Billing and Shipping Details

Messages and Requests

Helps and Hints

Home and Sign

Feedbacks / Complaints

In Cart view, User can see their item list with their cumulative total item
price. User can select the cart items from selecting the lift side check box
of each item. Also, when user selects checkboxes, total amount will show only
for selected items in cart. Not only that, also It helps to activate multiple
delete items option. View Details button use for view the details of the
product and User can order the selected items by clicking Place order button.

This section includes the wireframes that come under Messages and Requests
when a users communicate with other users.

 **Main Sections -**

Message List

Create a new message

View Message

Notification List

Notification Details

Request List

User can reach this page by clicking create message button in Message list
page. In this page, user can fill required fields in this page. For send the
message, User should click send Message button. User can redirect to the
message list page by clicking back button.
This view shows a list containing details of promotions.

This is the view showing the Expert review results related to the current
working project. It shows the list of reviews with the Expert approval status
as a badge. Additional details regarding review results can be displayed using
the View button. If the approval status is Rejected, an additional review can
be requested depending on the subscription plan or by making a payment.

This is the marketplace view showing the details of the security policies that
are being sold. They are shown as separate card views. The trending items can
be identified by the presence of the trending icon. Additional details can be
viewed by clicking on the View button. Client Manager can also add items to
the Wishlist by clicking on Add to Wishlist. Items can be added to cart using
the Add to cart button.

This view shows the details of the certification projects that are assigned to
the Client Manager. Additional details can be viewed by clicking on the View
button. By clicking on the Expand button, the details of the step areas that
come under the selected project will be shown. By clicking on the Back button,
system will redirect to tenant details page.

This view shows the frequently asked questions related to a step in a certain
project step area. Client manager can expand/ collapse the answers by clicking
on the plus and minus icons respectively. By clicking on the back button,
system will redirect to the previous step question page.

This view displays all details about project step time logs and it can be
accessed when the time log approval status is either 'Pending' or 'Escalated'.
From here, the Client manager can approve the time log duration if s/he is
satisfied with it. Else, s/he can escalate it by sending a message to the
consumer side by changing the status to 'Escalated'. By clicking on the Back
button, Client manager can navigate to the page showing the time log details
of the project step area.

This view shows the security policy templates of the Client-side Auditor that
are already being sold in the marketplace. A preview of the template can be
viewed from here.

This is the read-only view of the promotion details for a security policy
template. By clicking the Back button, system redirects to the Promoted
content view.

This is the ‘employee details’ view. From here, the CTO can add new employees
to the tenant’s employee pool. S/he can also view details and delete existing
employees.

This form is to allocate Client managers to the selected certification
project. The CTO can also remove managers by clicking on the Deallocate button
near the manager's name. By clicking on the Back button, CTO can navigate to
Tenant details page.

This form is to edit the tenant details of a selected tenant. The tenant's
name cannot be changed. By clicking on the Back button, CTO can navigate to
Tenant details page.

This view shows the assigned project details of the Client-side expert. By
clicking on the Back button, Client-side expert can navigate to Tenant details
page.

This page shows the step questions and answers belonging to a step that has
already been reviewed. Clicking the Back button will redirect to the list of
reviewed steps.

This view shows the list of topics that belong to a particular security policy
template. Here, new topics can be entered and they will be displayed in the

When Expand button is clicked, it redirects to the view showing the sub topics

that has been approved by the Consumer-side auditor. By clicking the Back

This is the view showing the common details of a selected security policy
template. Consumer-side auditor can navigate to edit form for policy templates
by using the Edit Details button. By clicking the Back button, system
redirects to Default Templates view.

This view shows the preview of the certification templates. By clicking on the
Back button, the system will redirect to the previous certification template
details list view. After completion of the template, the Data entry officer
can send it for approval using Get Approval button.

This is the view showing the default security policy templates that have been
created. A new policy template can be created by using the Create New Policy
button. The details of the existing policy templates can be edited by using
the Edit button. The preview of the policy template content can be viewed by

This view shows the preview of the security policy templates. By clicking on
the Back button, the system will redirect to the previous approved policy
template details list view. The Data entry officer can publish it by using the

This is the form for the CSO to create tenants for the clients. By clicking on
the Back button, the system will navigate to ‘Tenant details’ view.

The CSO can select and allocate employees to a certain type of project using
this form. This is a scrollable view and the CSO can scroll to the relevant
section to assign employees (Expert managers, Experts, Site reviewers)
appropriately. Already assigned employees can also be deallocated using the
Deallocate button. By clicking the Back button, CSO can navigate to the
Employee Project Allocation details page.

This view shows the details of a subscription along with its features. New
features can be assigned by Assign Features button. Existing features can be
edited by Edit Assigned Features button.

This form is used to change the basic details of a selected customized
subscription plan. By clicking the Back button, CSO can navigate to the
Customized Subscription details page.

This form is to assign features to the selected customized subscription. By
clicking the Back button, the system will redirect to the read only view of a
selected customized subscription plan.

This form is used to add new features to the system, so that they can be
assigned to subscription plans. By clicking the Back button, the system will
redirect to the view showing the list of features.

This view shows the project step area that come under a selected client
project. By clicking on Expand, the steps that belong to the step area can be
viewed. The time logs entered by the Experts for completing client project
step areas can be displayed by using the view Time logs buttons. By clicking
on the Back button, the system redirects to the project details page.

This is the form to edit details of the selected step area. Data entry officer
can update the submissions of the uploaded files too.
This is the form to edit the details of an existing policy template.

metadata.title: New Trend Security Policy List In Marketplace
New Trend Security Policy List In Marketplace

__data__.text:
This view shows the Cybermity marketplace. Here, the trending security
policies, company policies and other products can be displayed separately
using tabs. Using the View button, additional details regarding the selected
item can be viewed. Site reviewer can make a request to purchase that item and

metadata.title: New Trend Security Policy List In Marketplace

__data__.text:
In Wishlist view, User can see the Listed Wishlist items according to the
subcategories in tab pane. View button in each Wishlist, helps to view more
details about Wishlist by redirecting to another view page. Add to cart button
in each Wishlist, helps to add the item to the client's purchasing items cart.
Remove button in each Wishlist, helps to Remove the selected items from client

User can reach this page by clicking message icon in the header bar. In this
page, User can see all notifications and if s/he wants to see the notification
in detail, should click view button of each specific notification.

Client-side Feedback Views

Consumer-side Feedback Views

Consumer-side users. It contains the pages relating to the insertion of new
content as well.

Frequently Asked Questions Categories page. User can add questions and their
answers by filling the given input areas properly and clicking on Submit Q&A
button. Edit button is used to edit Q&A and Delete button is used to delete

page by clicking back button.

and Answers for Categories page. When user wants to submit the updates, s/he
should click on Update Q&A button. User can redirect to the Questions and
Answers for Categories page by clicking back button.

metadata.title: Edit Questions and Answers for Categories

This view shows the feedbacks from supervisors and employees regarding the
projects that are assigned to the Client manager. Additional details can be
viewed by clicking on the view button.
The header tab will change depending on the type of user.

This is the view showing the default security policy templates that have been
created by the Consumer side auditor. A new policy template can be created by
clicking on the Create New Template. Also, the common details of the policy
template can be viewed or it can be deleted. By clicking on expand, the list

status of the project is shown as a badge. When the status is Ongoing, the

content. Once the status becomes Completed, the template can be sold in the
marketplace by clicking on the Sell Template button.

only the template name, type and description can be edited. By clicking the

template.

Back button, CSO can navigate to the Subscription details page.

By clicking the Back button, CSO can navigate to the Subscription details
page.

This view shows the step questions that come under a step area of a selected
client project. The Expert manager can assign experts and site reviewers to
the step by selecting from the dropdown and clicking on the plus icon.
Finally, the details can be saved using Save button. The expert manager can go
to the approval view so that s/he can review the steps completed by the client
using the Review Client Completed Step button. By clicking on the Back button,
the Expert manager can navigate to the Step details list view.

This view shows the list of default certification templates that have been

the Preview button.

been entered to the system. By clicking on the Back button, the system
redirects to Default certification details list page.

This view shows the new trending items in the marketplace. They will be
categorized under security policies, company policies and other products. The
newest trends of each category will be displayed at the top. Here also,
additional details can be viewed by clicking on the View button. Expert
manager can also add items to the Wishlist by clicking on Add to Wishlist.
Items can be added to cart using the Add to cart button.

This is the form to create a new step. Here, the Data entry officer can upload
a step guidance video and hints document using the Choose file.

metadata.title: Edit Project Step Time log Details

__data__.text:
This form can be used by the Expert manager to change the total duration of
the time log according to the discussion carried out with the client. Entering

Modified (14/07/2022):

Added new column to pages table called “level” having values “T“ for tenant
level and “P“ for project level.

The pages that are not directly related with a specific project and the
functionalities associated with those pages are included as tenant level. The
assignment of such permissions will be handled by the “Custom permission“
button in tenant employee pool view. When saving these permissions in user
permission table, only tenant id is saved along with the permission.

The pages that are directly related with a specific project and the
functionalities associated with those pages are included as project level.
User role creation will be done on tenant level which means user roles created
will be accessible to all projects within the tenant.

However, the permission setting for all the user roles will be done on project
level pages. So, their permissions will be assigned as such. The role
assignment for users will also be done in project level. Ex: If user U is
assigned to role R in project P, U will have the permissions included in R
only within P.

Apart from that, the “Custom permission“ button in project employee pool view
will be used to give project level permissions for specific users. When saving
these permissions in user permission table, both tenant id and project id are
saved along with the permission.

When checking for permissions, the permissions of the logged in user will be
retrieved. For tenant level pages, only the tenant id will be used as a filter
and for project level pages, both the tenant id and project id will be used as
a filter.

This is done to avoid confusions when assigning permissions to users and
roles.

**Cybermity- frontend**

This is the frontend of the Cybermity project. Here used javascript based
React js technologies and additional libraries such as MUI, react-beautiful-
dnd, react-checkbox-tree are used. This includes frontend client side and
consumer side user designs and api services.

 **Cybermity - backend**

This is the backend of the Cybermity project. The main technologies used are
node js, Mongo DB and mysql. Background content is based on MVC architecture
and includes models, controllers and apis. There are two types, sql and nosql.
For the user management section we used mysql and for the rest of the tables
we used mongo db. All apis written here have been tested with jest and
supertest.

Backend testing is a testing technique that examines a web application's
server side or database. To make sure that the online application or program
is free from database flaws like deadlock, data corruption, or data loss etc.

In our project Cybermity we are using NodeJS for the backend development. So,
to do the backend testing we went through some testing tools compatible with
NodeJS.

Following are some tools we came across for testing

  1. Jest - Jest is a testing framework developed by Facebook. With features like a built-in assertion library, code coverage, and mocking, it was first created to make UI testing simpler for React developers. However, it is now a complete standalone suite of tools for any sort of JavaScript project (including Node.js).

  2. Mocha - Mocha is one of the oldest and most well-known testing frameworks for Node.js. It’s evolved with Node.js and the JavaScript language over the years, such as supporting callbacks, promises, and async/await. It has also picked up a few tricks inspired by other test runners

  3. Lab and Code - Lab is part of the hapi developer ecosystem. At first, Walmart Labs created it to integrate easily with the hapi web framework. It functions well both by itself and in collaboration with other Node.js frameworks.

  4. AVA - AVA is a much more opinionated test runner. Like lab, there are no magic global functions. Like Jest, it executes tests in parallel, which can speed up test performance.

In Cybermity we are using NodeJS for the backend development. We thought of
going with Jest for our backend testing as Jest is highly compatible with
NodeJS and it comes with some built in libraries for code coverage, mocking
etc. And Jest is intended to guarantee the accuracy of any JavaScript
codebase. It enables us to create tests using an easy-to-use, well-known,
feature-rich API that provides results promptly.

 **Jest**

Jest is used most for unit testing. Unit testing is when you provide input to
a unit of code (usually, a function) and match the output with the expected
output.

**Setting up a jest project**

  * Install the jest module using npm.

npm install --save-dev Jest

  * Install the jest module globally using the flag ' -g

npm install -g jest

  * Then, go to your package.json file and change this part:

"scripts": {

"test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"

},

To:

"scripts": {

"test": "jest"

},

  * Write Test

//test case 01 - add new userType

test('Backend Test Case 01 - Should insert a user type', async () => {

await request(app).post('/usertype/create').send({

userType:"Employee123",

}).expect(200).then((res) => {

id = res.body.insertId;

});

})

  * Run the test

npm test or npm run test

Coding standards are a set of guidelines and best practices for writing code
in a consistent and organized manner. Here it will be specific to Javascript
which is the based language in this project.

Here are some findings….

 **Available tools**

  1.  _ESLint:_ ESLint is a popular open-source linting tool for JavaScript. It allows you to define custom rules and check your code against a wide range of best practices and coding standards.

  2.  _Prettier_ : Prettier is an opinionated code formatter for JavaScript that automatically formats your code to follow a consistent style, regardless of your personal coding preferences.

  3.  _Stylelint_ : Stylelint is a linting tool specifically for checking CSS in JavaScript projects. It can help you enforce a consistent style for your CSS and avoid common pitfalls, such as invalid syntax or inconsistent use of indentation.

  4.  _JSLint_ : JSLint is an older JavaScript linting tool that is still widely used by many developers. It enforces a strict set of coding standards and is often used to identify potential bugs and issues in JavaScript code.

  5.  _JSHint_ : JSHint is another popular linting tool for JavaScript that can help you enforce coding standards in your code.

For Cybermity, we use a combination of some of the above tools. Because to
ensure that the code base meets the desired standards. Those selected tools
are ESLint and Prettier.

ESLint is suitable due to its customizability and adaptability. ESLint allows
us to define our own rules which are the codebase able to follow.

The reason for using Prettier is to format the code according to a consistent
style. It automatically formats the codebase.

**Rules for Frontend:**

The amount of your code that is covered by automated tests is referred to as
test coverage. It is a measure of how much of your code has been exercised by
your tests.

The number of lines of code, functions, or branches that have been run by your
tests is typically used to calculate test coverage. For instance, if a
function has ten lines of code and all ten of those lines are tested, the
function has 100% test coverage. On the other side, you only have 50% test
coverage if your tests only cover five of the 10 lines of code.

Because it enables you to find parts of your code that are not covered by your
tests, test coverage is important. These uncovered areas may contain bugs that
could cause problems in your application. You can boost your assurance that
your code is functioning as expected by raising your test coverage.

It is crucial to remember that test coverage by itself does not ensure the
effectiveness of your tests or the accuracy of your code. It is possible to
have high test coverage while still having flaws in your code or poor test
coverage while still having a thoroughly tested and dependable application.
Therefore, test coverage should be used as one of several metrics for
evaluating the effectiveness of your testing strategy.

##  Relevant data

Coding standards are a set of guidelines and best practices for writing code
in a consistent and organized manner. Here it will be specific to Javascript
which is the based language in this project.

##  Background

For Cybermity, we use a combination of some of the above tools. Because to
ensure that the code base meets the desired standards. Those selected tools
are ESLint and Prettier.

ESLint is suitable due to its customizability and adaptability. ESLint allows
us to define our own rules which are the codebase able to follow.

The reason for using Prettier is to format the code according to a consistent
style. It automatically formats the codebase.

##  Options Considered

|

 **Option 1 - ESLint**

|

 **Option 2 - Prettier**

|

 **Option 3 - Stylelint**

|

 **Option 4 - JSLint**  
  
---|---|---|---|---  
  
 **Description**

|

ESLint is a popular open-source linting tool for JavaScript. It allows you to
define custom rules and check your code against a wide range of best practices
and coding standards.

|

Prettier is an opinionated code formatter for JavaScript that automatically
formats your code to follow a consistent style, regardless of your personal
coding preferences.

|

Stylelint is a linting tool specifically for checking CSS in JavaScript
projects. It can help you enforce a consistent style for your CSS and avoid
common pitfalls, such as invalid syntax or inconsistent use of indentation.

|

JSLint is an older JavaScript linting tool that is still widely used by many
developers. It enforces a strict set of coding standards and is often used to
identify potential bugs and issues in JavaScript code.  
  
 **Pros and cons**

|

easily integrate to IDEs

can auto fix style errors

Configuring ESLint can be time-consuming and challenging

​​ ESLint has plugins for many popular IDEs, integrating it with development
environment can be challenging

|

easily integrate to IDEs

can auto fix style errors

Prettier has limited customization options

​​ Limited scope

|

|  
  
 **Estimated cost**

|

YellowMedium

|

YellowMedium

|

|  
  
##  Action items

Add action items to close the loop on open questions or concerns.

1 incomplete Type your task here. Use "@" to assign a user and "//" to select
a due date.

##  Outcome

Summarize the outcome. After considering the options and evaluation criteria,
we have decided to use ESLint for our coding standard checker. Its ease of
configuration and customization, excellent integration with IDEs and plugins,
and wide range of issue detection make it the best choice for our needs. It
also has a large and active community and is open source, making it a cost-
effective solution.
